name: Omni Orlando Resort at Championsgate

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel the weekend of 10/9/09. The hotel is beautiful and VERY clean. The are three pools including a lazy river pool (where we spent most of the afternoons) and a couple of hot tubs. It has a par three golf course that is included in the resort fees (16.00/day) as well as beautiful championship courses. Parking is free (and an easy walk to the hotel) but you can opt for valet if you want. Internet is included in the resort fee and they offer both wired and wireless connections.
reviews.title: Great Resort Hotel - Perfect Location - Highly recommended

reviews.text: The grounds are immaculate. In fact there were two weddings the weekend that we were there. Service is very good. All staff were attentive to our needs but never intrusive.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel. Everything we expected and more.

reviews.text: It is about a 10-15 minute ride to Disney but a very easy drive. I would highly recommend this hotel for those who want a truly great resort experience without getting caught up in all of teh hustle and bustle of the areas around Disneyworld.
reviews.title: Can't wait to Return!

reviews.text: I stayed here with my mother for four nights earlier this month. The hotel staff was very friendly. The property is beautiful with several pools and a lazy river. Everything was very clean and well-kept. It was very relaxing to hop in a tube and circle around the lazy river a few times. They also have a zero entry pool, a water slide, activities and playground for the kids and a quiet pool with cabanas available for rent. There are chairs set about everywhere and it was easy for us to find a perfect spot in the sun or in the shade. The pools are beautifully landscaped.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel

reviews.text: They had complimentary transportation to the Disney parks that we had to set up in advance. Our reservation for the van was lost, but they were able to work it out and get us on the morning shuttle anyway. The only downside is the shuttle is a shared shuttle so it took us about an hour to get home from the park. We drove to the Magic Kingdom and the drive was about 15 min or so each way - closer than we thought we would be. The town of Celebration is also close by.
reviews.title: One of the best experiences ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it! The staff was always cheerful and helpful. We wanted a stress free couple of days relaxing and it filled what we were looking for. We spent our days on the lazy river, then restaurants in the area then back to the lazy river and pools. I loved the fountains in the jacuzzi! And the fire pit to sit around was a nice touch.
reviews.title: lazying around the lazy river

reviews.text: Champions Gate is a golf resort that served us well for a conference. The property is well maintained. The staff gets the highest marks for professionalism and congeniality. I used the fitness center, ran on the cart paths at night, ate at Trevi's and conference events. We also took advantage of the morning beverage service by virtue of being a Select Guest member. It was very pleasant overall. This was my second visit to this property and my second very nice experience.
reviews.title: A nice place with superior staff

reviews.text: While the pool area and accommodations were nice, my experience with parking there will ensure I never stay at the resort again. After leaving my car parked one night in the $16 a night parking lot that is supposedly patrolled by security, I experienced trouble while driving. A bit uncomfortable, I drove to a auto repair store where the mechanic revealed to me that someone had attempted to steal my tires, as several lug nuts were missing. Not only was he completely shocked that I was able to drive my vehicle without losing a tire, he recommended I look into charges for vehicular manslaughter.
reviews.title: Watch for Car Tire Theft!!

reviews.text: Two hours and $166 later, I was able to drive my car.
reviews.title: Great Family Experience

reviews.text: After several calls with the Omni Resort security staff, I was told by their customer service that the hotel assumes no responsibility for damage incurred on their property (as I expected). Additionally, they have no video cameras monitoring their parking lots.
reviews.title: Golf and a Lazy River

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here six nights (our second visit) while he attended a convention in Orlando. Chose this site because we wanted to be out of the crowds; it's about a twelve mile easy drive down I-4 from the Orlando Convention Center. Disney is located between the two. This Championsgate area is newly developed, upscale, small (encompasses just a few square blocks off the interstate), with a Chiles, Publix, liquor store, pizzaria, and Walgreen's in the surrounding area. Needs more nice restaurants, but a sign showed that future development is planned.
reviews.title: Beautiful, quiet, well-managed golf resort south of Orlando

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful; the clientele appears to be mainly golfers and business. There were not many children. The hotel's parking is convenient and free. Landscaping is spectacular and immaculate. The entry has a courtyard appearance with brick pavers and plants and a fountain. The lobby is expansive, beautiful, and overlooks fountains, pools, and the golf course.
reviews.title: Lots to like with a few exceptions

reviews.text: The desk staff is very professional, friendly and efficient. We had a king, balcony room (balconies have a small table and two cushioned chairs) with a lovely view of the golf course. The rooms are large, contemporary, upscale, comfortable, clean, with mini-bar and safe. We slept great: very comfortable beds and no noise from adjacent rooms. We did hear an occasional door slam in the hallway. The maid service was unobtrusive and there were no odors. That about covers the basics! Our only problem was the original room (7th floor) partially overlooked the pools, and they turn on the pool music around 9 am and along with a few children yelling at the pool, it made the balcony a bit loud for us while trying to sit out there and read. (This noise was not audible inside the room). So we transferred to another balcony room, this time overlooking the entrance and parking lot, but here the air conditioners atop the lower floors sounded like 747s warming up...but we resigned ourselves. On a previous trip we had a balcony room overlooking the villas and golf course, and that was very quiet.
reviews.title: Refreshing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate a very nice meal in David's, had room service (over-cooked, but tasty fillet) one night, and had deli sandwiches twice. The pools were lovely, the adult pools quiet and calm with just the sound of fountains. There is a lazy river, very nice.
reviews.title: Greatest Vacation Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Golf. It's expensive here, so we played at Ridgeland Lakes, just four miles south, very reasonable. We did play the 9 hole 3-par course (free) at the Omni for practice on one's short game and enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Omni in Championsgate is a fine hotel. However, as another reviewer had put it, "it lacks soul". We are checking out today at noon, and we arrived on the 19th (today is the 22nd). The pool area looks like a lot of fun, however, it is 50 degrees and veyr cold outside, so the pools were useless to us.
reviews.title: It's just OK

reviews.text: I was surprised to not see any Christmas lights, or trees in the lobby or around the hotel. What is up with that??? All we saw were some poinsettas, and a gingerbread house/ town.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!

reviews.text: The hotel felt very empty, and lacked a lot of life. I'm probably being unfair though, since I have stayed at Gaylord palms several times, it is hard not to compare to that standard. Gaylord goes out of its way to be a warm and jovial environment for its guests.
reviews.title: hotel and staff are great/wish there was not a kids sports group here!

reviews.text: Gaylord also provides Dasani water for FREE, and includes Valet in the resort fee. Unlike the Omni.
reviews.title: Awesome !!!

reviews.text: The only reason I compare the two, is because they are close in distance, and are large "resorts" in the area.
reviews.title: Wish I'd been here for leisure!

reviews.text: A friend recommended this resort. We live in tampa and were just looking for a weekend getaway. I attempted to book the reservation online for a two room package, but I kept getting charged a separate price for each room so I called the resort directly. Front desk staff, BJ, booked the reservation for me. it took one hour total to book the reservation. I should have taken this as a foreboding of what was to come. Upon email confirmation from the resort of our upcoming stay 4 weeks after placing the reservation, i noted a mistake in the total number of guests in our party. I immediately called the resort and made them aware that we were a party of 4, not 2. I was told my rate would jump another $96/night. I protested, explaining that it was not my fault that BJ did not accurately place the reservation. 35 minutes later and after much protest, I was told they would honor the rate that I was quoted when the reservation was made. I guess they were doing me a favor for their mistake?! I checked in at 2, was charged the total for my 3 night stay PLUS Incidentals, as they call it, another $300. Seven hours later I was charged another 3 night stay charge on my card. I immediately went to the front desk and spoke with jasmine, who had nothing intelligable to say about this extraneous charge. She disappeared for 15 minutes and came back to say that Carlos, the manager on duty, had stepped out with another guest. One hour and 45 minutes and one more phone call to front desk, we have heard nothing. Our bank account has been charged more than double for our 3 night stay. Would I stay again? Absolutely not. Would I recommend this resort to a friend? Absolutely not. I cannot express my extreme disappointment in such a big name chain resort. Additionally, I am not even going to go into the lack of professional service that we encountered all day long...from lack of bellman at check in, one hour wait for luggage to be brought to room, no server for drinks at the "formal pool", etc, etc, etc. What should have been a relaxing weekend for my wife has started off as an exasperating, frustrating, miserable experience.
reviews.title: One of the worst experiences in a major hotel chain

reviews.text: A lovely hotel although travel agents will not advise you of the additional US $20 a night resort fee just that a resort fee is payable. But an excellent hotel providing peace from the days activities, in fact at times my 10 year old was wanting to play in the pool and lazy river instead of visiting the Parks. Excellent staff and a lovely hotel even though noise levels from other residents can be high on occasions (Wedding Guests? staying over slightly intoxicated) but not the hotels fault. Families are made very welcome and children can get to and from rooms avoiding the lobby when they are in swimwear so a very successful split from business to family pleasure. Ensure you join the OMNI loyalty Programme before you stay for extra benefits.
reviews.title: Omni Champions Gate Florida Holiday

reviews.text: We serve in a convention management role and have recommended/contracted this Omni property for multiple events. The professionalism and friendliness of staff coupled with an attention to detail is exemplary! Conference attendees agree... this is an extraordinary property to enjoy as both a vacationer as well as for conducting business.
reviews.title: Omni Championsgate Delivers Another 1st Class Meeting!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Championsgate for a long weekend at the end of the summer. We were very pleased with the overall Italian Villa feel of the resort. The pools were spectacular and the service friendly, though not as attentive as other resorts we have visited. Enjoyed the online check-in process, but had to ask for our key at the front desk anyway. They don't leave them beside the front desk like it says in the instructions for obvious security reasons. Prices for food and drink were a bit high, but that's to be expected at a resort property. An all-inclusive package would be appealing. I enjoyed a spa treatment during our stay and found the facility beautiful, well-appointed, and reasonably priced. Our King room was comfortable, but could have used some touch-up paint and a carpet cleaning. The bathroom was quite nice and well-stocked with toiletries and other essentials. We would stay there again as long as the price per night remains reasonable.
reviews.title: Omni Championsgate Resort is a Contender

reviews.text: The resort was my children's dream....there months open when they saw the pool area. My son thought he was at a water park. My daughter is a teenager and she even loved this hotel. The location is good your about 10 minutes away from the parks. grocery store is around the corner. Staff is very rude, I guess they feel as though since the resorts is beautiful they have the right to be rude. lol
reviews.title: Wonderful property but horrible staff.

reviews.text: Stayed with my husband and children aged 8 and 6 for a week before heading down to the keys! Our third visit and first in a hotel having previously stayed in villas.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.text: Loved the Omni, it's amazing the staff are helpful it's spotlessly clean and has some great running routes round the golf course for two keen runners. The pool area was fabulous and our children both had a fantastic time in the lazy river.
reviews.title: The Perfect Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is really handy for the I4 and also the 192 to Disney, with a supermarket and a few restaurants just down the road.
reviews.title: Great stay!!

reviews.text: We had a fabulous time here and would defiantly return if the price was right, next stop Omni Cancun!
reviews.title: Great Overall Experience

reviews.text: As a business traveler, I recently stayed at the Omni for 3 nights to attend a conference. I was a bit reluctant to bring my family as I was unaware of the overrall hotel accommodations. However, I am so glad my family joined as we really did not have to leave the hotel since there were several restaurants and family activities. This is a great place for business and pleasure!
reviews.title: Great to Unforgetable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel all over for business and leisure and by far this was the worst hotel I have ever had a reservation in. I say reservation instead of stay because after two hours we up and left! It is clear that this hotel is looking for a certain clientele. We are in our thirties and had just drove from St Pete from a glorious four night stay. We booked the Omni through Priceline and it's clear they want to give you the worst rooms.
reviews.title: The Worst Hotel Ever...Outside is all fluff, Service is Horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience started as soon as we pulled up. My husband stayed with the bellman and I went to check in. I check in and of course no king beds only double. My husband called in July and put a request in but as usual you get the same old a request is only a request. It was 1pm on a Tue and we were checking out on Fri...Whatever... I go upstairs and our room is clear across the otherside of the hotel, it has a real funky lay out and by the time I hit our room I was exhausted! I go inside and the room is worn. I was so disappointed. Now at check in the front desk receptionist said she upgraded our room and it had a small balcony. The room overlooked the parking lot! The furnishings were scratched and the bed had this very uncomfortable duvet that was very rough. No fridge because they want to make sure they get that mini bar in. No flat screen TV's this hotel is not that old?? It's like all fluff beautiful outside and lobby area but the interior is brutal.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, excellent staff and service.
Telephone rates are extortionate
reviews.text: About 15 minutes later my husband shows up....WITH THE LUGGAGE CART???? I asked him why he has the luggage cart and he said the bellman rolled it inside the door left it there unattended and went back outside. He said he stood off to the side to see what was going to happen and after about 10 minutes he took the cart and rolled it upstairs. Nobody stopped him...the front desk had no clue who he was because I had checked in alone....rolled it right by everyone not one word said. I later read the luggage tag and of course it says they are not liable for loss. We could have had everyhing stolen. I'm heated now. I go to the front desk and after waiting 15 minutes a assistant manager comes out and says he is sorry and offers us a king bed room with no balcony. Where did the king bed come from? I was told they did not have any? We ask for a balcony king bed pool view that was a no. He then offers a double bed with what he says is a nice room with a balcony. We said fine whatever this is all exhausting now. I go to the room and believe it or not it's worst if that was even possible it's a view of the roof below and the middle of the parking lot. Is he seriousI have enough and call the 800 Omni number and talk to customer relations. They were shocked at what was going on and said they were emailing the hotel manager and that I should go to the front desk and talk only to him.

Again we go downstairs and wait another 15 minutes for the manager. I don't know why we are kept waiting...there was nobody around. He comes out with an attitude. I was shocked. How dare he talk to any customer in that manner. He was rude and pompous. While we were waiting for him the front desk clerk checked a older gentleman in and said to him Mr....we have availability to upgrade you to a king pool balcony room.....My mouth dropped......Just because I'm in my thirties and had on a tank top and shorts does not mean I'm any less of a customer. I repeat what I heard to the manager and he said I must have been mistaken. He then tells me our luggage is protected unattended in the lobby....I couldn't take anymore and we request a refund and he says priceline would have to give it to us, which priceline has refunded. Another thing this hotel is in the middle of nowhere. It is not a desirable location in the least.
reviews.title: excellent, loved it

reviews.text: We ended up staying at a renovated villa at the Sheraton Vistana for the exact price we would have paid for this awful hotel. The Sheraton was gorgeous! There are too many choices for hotels in the Orlando area do yourself a favor and stay somewhere that your money is appreciated. I can't imagine if you have kids.....Definetly not a kid friendly hotel...
reviews.title: Not perfect, but very nice

reviews.text: Wonderful experience for 1 night at the Omni. Nice room, beautiful property! Loved the lazy river and the pools! If you have kids go to the main pool (it can get noisy), if you are a couple or just want some relaxation time, head to the formal pool. The formal pool is not for you if you want to make a lot of noise, as when I was there, there were other people, but you could hear no noise! A bit of advice on the pool--make sure you can reserve a chair if the hotel is crowded--otherwise you may be out of luck! I had the breakfast buffet--was good, but seemed a little expensive which was expected. Didn't run into any issues with the staff, and coupled with such a beautiful property, my stay was wonderful! Would love to stay again next time I am in the area. Make sure to join their Select Guest program before staying at any Omni!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Housekeeping let them down on this trip to Orlando. No soap, dingy linen and many areas in need of repair. Service was great at the steak house. Food met expectations and more. Prices since our last stay seemed to have multiplied. How about the nerve to charge a guest $6.00 for a bottle of water because it was placed in the room. It seems to me that most high end properties at least comp. the water. If the intent was to create a super destination resort, they failed. It was good, but fell way short of being exceptional. Oh, by the way no toilet paper one day just to make our stay complete.
reviews.title: It's the small things that matter

reviews.text: My experience at check in was horrible. The room I received had the all the ac equipment outside...über noisy. I called the front desk 7 times ( no kidding) before an operator picked up. I then had to wait close to 30 mins for the bell man to meet me at the other room with the keys. Finally dropped my bags off, then walked the long haul back to the parking lot to get my car so I could back offsite, only to find that my keys did not work at the gate. Honest mistake. Switched rooms, switched keys...gate pass didn't get put back on the new key. However, I proceeded to call the front desk to get someone to let me thru the gate...they transferred me to valet...who kept telling me they were opening the gate...not sure what gate...all this time no gate attendant. After about five minutes, I had to have the line of vehicles behind me back up so I could get back out of the line. I called them back they kept apologizing, yet they did nothing, since I was still driving round and round the parking lot. Finally, after five minutes a gate attendant made it to the booth, clueless as to what I had experienced. The funny thing is, I stayed based on a referral, and spent way more than I would have spent elsewhere. Very disappointing. Will never do that again.
reviews.title: Beautiful property...horrible service...

reviews.text: My family stayed here for two days. This is a nice resort and a great getaway. Get a room and getaway. We enjoyed the resort outdoor amenities. They have a nice pool, water slide, lazy river and a bar. This was a great getaway relaxer for 2 days.
reviews.title: Nice resort getaway destination

reviews.text: We stayed from 13th to 23rd of July, it was our 3rd stay at the omni, another fab stay, lovely hotel, lovely rooms, loved the pools and lazy river. Breakfast at trevi's was fab, snacks at broadway deli was lovely as always. Everything has been positive again. Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay at the omni

aka: Omni Orlando Resort At Championsgate Hotel
description: The four-diamond Omni Orlando Resort at ChampionsGate, located just 6 miles from Walt Disney World(R) Resort, provides scheduled transportation to the Walt Disney World(R) Theme Parks. In addition to 36 holes of championship golf, guests enjoy 15 acres of recreation including an 850 ft. lazy river, zero entry family pool, formal pool with private cabanas, and a lighted, 9-hole par 3 golf course, signature Mokara Spa and fitness center, and seven on-site dining options. The main resort features 720 newly renovated guest rooms. In addition, there are 49 two- and three-bedroom luxury resort villas, equipped with full kitchens, a dining room, living room and private patio.
